description.plain:
Jeremy Scott Zucker (born March 3, 1996) is a New Jersey native singer, songwriter, and producer inspired by the likes of Jon Bellion and Bon Iver. His music ranges from indie-electronica up until hip-hop.

Jeremy’s debut EP, Beach Island, came out in the August of 2015 followed by his second EP, Breathe, which released later that year.

The next year, his first LP project, Motions, released under 3OAK Music, a label he co-founded with Daniel James and Benjamin O. He later signed with Republic Records when each of his tracks reached over one million streams across various platforms.

On July 14, 2017, Jeremy released “talk is overrated,” which teased his third EP, idle. The EP featured R&B artist blackbear.

To finish off 2017, Jeremy released the single, “every day (stripped.),” followed by his fourth EP, stripped.. stripped. is an almost entirely acoustic EP revisiting three of his previous songs and creating two new ones. It was released in February of the following year.

During his final collegiate year, Jeremy teased his 6th EP, glisten, with his singles “all the kids are depressed” and “better off”. He was also signed with Visionary Music Group which included Logic and Jon Bellion. glisten finally released shortly after his tour show on May 4, 2018. In the same month, Jeremy graduated from Colorado College, a small liberal arts college famous for their block program, where he studied pre-med.

On September 28 of the same year, Jeremy’s seventh EP, summer, launched. It featured his most popular hit, “comethru” and “thinking 2 much,” a collaboration with EDEN.

In 2019, after touring Europe, Jeremy released his eighth EP, brent, in collaboration with pop-edm singer and producer, Chelsea Cutler, on May 3. It released alongside with an acoustic version of the EP.

On June 11, Jeremy announced via Instagram that he had started working on his debut album. A month later, the first single of his project, “oh, mexico,” was released.
Jeremy released “always, I’ll care” on February 7, 2020, six months after his previous release.

On the 10th of February 2020, he announced the title of his debut album as love is not dying which was set to be released on April 17, 2020. He then went on to release two more singles, “not ur friend,” on February 28, 2020, and “julia” on March 23, 2020.

Jeremy’s tracks, “all the kids are depressed” and “you were good to me,” featuring Chelsea Cutler, received the Gold Certification by RIAA on the 3rd of April, 2020.

songs.title: ​comethru

description.plain:
“Comethru” is the opening track for Jeremy Zucker’s EP, summer,. The song lays out the mindset of Jeremy as he was transitioning into a new lifestyle.

Jeremy graduated from college shortly before releasing this song. While he watched his friends move into full time jobs, Jeremy found himself locked in his parents' basement. He was working many hours to create and produce music like this song.

In the song, Jeremy sings about how he dealt with the idea of working while his friends were out celebrating their last summer before 18. In a tweet, Jeremy also stated that he wrote the song all alone during a summer while being bored and lonely.

songs.title: ​talk is overrated

description.plain:
“talk is overrated” is a single by New Jersey pop artist, Jeremy Zucker with R&B artist blackbear featuring on it.

In the song, a whole story is told of a complicated relationship that started off as an uncomplicated relationship, where the artist didn’t know what he wanted out of it. But the relationship became complicated as soon as feelings and emotions were let out. After this relationship, a new style of relationship is tried out, a no feelings, no strings attached, one-night stand.

songs.embed_content: Read “​talk is overrated” by Jeremy Zucker on Genius

songs.full_title: ​all the kids are depressed by Jeremy Zucker
songs.title: ​all the kids are depressed

description.plain:
“all the kids are depressed” is the first single from Jeremy’s EP glisten. In the song, Jeremy addresses depression in children and youth.

In a Genius verified video, Jeremy explained the meaning of the song. He wrote the song to legitimize depression and acknowledge its existence to people. He stated that after his graduation, he moved into a house with his friends. Everyone living there took antidepressants except Jeremy. Since all his friends were depressed, he felt that the illness needed more attention and awareness worldwide.

Before the song’s release, Jeremy sent out a casting call for the music video of “all the kids are depressed” on Twitter. In an interview with Billboard, Jeremy stated that he sent out the casting call to obtain people’s stories on depression and how they overcame it. He wanted people to be heard and validated. After he received videos from various people worldwide, he implemented their stories into his music video for “all the kids are depressed.”

songs.embed_content: Read “​all the kids are depressed” by Jeremy Zucker on Genius
